alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 27 at 8:25PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Willow Creek near Willow City affecting McHenry and Bottineau Counties. .Recent snowmelt will push Willow Creek near Willow City above minor flood stage early Friday morning. The creek is expected to remain above minor flood stage at least through the end of this week. Chances for rain this weekend on top of melting snow could prolong flooding in this area through the weekend and possibly into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Willow Creek near Willow City. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1441 feet, Water begins backing up into ravines and gets to top of road by gage. At 1443 feet, Overflow occurs on left bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 1441.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning and continue rising to near 1444 feet early next week. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 1442 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1443.9 feet on 07/12/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
